intro: Zoegea deluensis, commonly known as the Deluensian zoegea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from purple to pink. The plant features opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
